page.title: 01AYLESFORD,ECCLES AND AREA
page.content: The D block covers a small part of the village of Aylesford,and the land to the north as far as the North Downs including Eccles village. Most of land is agricultural; cereals predominate,with some woodland. Aylesford is about 3 miles from the County Town Maidstone.There has been a settlement at Aylesford since prehistoric times, probably because it was the lowest fording point on the River Medway.Recent development, housing and warehousing is also linked with transport routes;the proximety of 2 Motorways M2 (London-Dover) and M20/M26 (folkestone-London and the west).Eccles grew up to provide homes for workers in the cement industry in the mid 19th century.The clay and chalk pits are now worked out.
